author: {'steamid': '76561198010077003', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1684100893}
review:
4/5
Avventura a tema horror psicologico. Stilisticamente è molto ben fatta, sia nelle atmosfere che nello stile. Interessante anche la meccanica di dovere letteralmente morire per proseguire. Gli enigmi sono abbastanza semplici (anche grazie ai suggerimenti della "hotline"), e in effetti come suggerito dal gioco stesso non mi sono mai trovato a cercare di risolverne qualcuno forzando la soluzione provando "tutto con tutto". Da segnalare un paio di difetti, se così si possono definire: il primo è la brevità dell'avventura, purtroppo solo la metà della media di questo genere di avventure. Il secondo è invece l'enorme quantità di citazioni e riferimenti presenti ad altre opere, soprattutto della mitologia nordica: credo che senza le note sia impossibile coglierle tutte. Per fare un esempio non avrei mai notato che un personaggio parla soltanto citando versi della "Ecclesiaste", un libro della bibbia. Tanto di cappello alla ricerca storiografica comunque!
Nel complesso comunque un ottimo gioco, per molti versi originale, sicuramente consigliato!
developer_response: Grazie mille per le belle parole! Non sono sicuro che sia *necessario* conoscere tutti i riferimenti e le citazioni, anche se suppongo che aiuti. Puoi incolpare il tuo connazionale Umberto Ecco per avermi tentato sulla via dell'intertestualità. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198030163652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1664925109}
review:
Strangeland is a wonderful game. I won't spoil anything (and I recommend you try not to spoil yourself either), but it is a truly dark and interesting tale that lives up to its name. 

It is made by the developers of Primordia, which is easily one of my favorite games of all time. This is another hit by Wormwood in my opinion. Comparing the two is a bit hard as they have very different settings and themes, so I'd be weary of anyone that tries. Both games are phenomenal. 

Strangeland is definitely quite abstract, and many of the references and quotes require a bit of knowledge to understand fully. That's not a flaw, as you're not missing anything if you don't catch them, since even at face value it's generally quite understandable (and I'm sure I missed more references and quotes than I understood). I don't think it's for everyone, certainly some people might find it a bit pretentious (I don't, but I've seen some reviews state this). In my opinion, calling it that is a disservice to the developers and their own feelings and emotions they poured into this veritable masterpiece. 

As far as the actual gameplay goes, it's generally very intuitive. I don't recall more than one or two times I was stuck on something. Wormwood is quite good at making point-and-click games without the usual twisted logic that some of them have (you know, the kind of logic where you scratch your head and wonder how you were ever supposed to figure that out without googling). I'm happy to say the game is entirely beatable without looking up any guides or walk throughs. In order to 100% it, you may need one though (or the patience of a saint), but that's most games in fairness. 

All in all, I love strangeland. It's beautifully abstract, introspective, deep, twisted, and intriguing. I look forward to any future projects Wormwood may make. 

It is a bit short, my ~5 hours playtime beat the game and then ran through a couple of the different endings (not from start to finish, from various end game save points). If you rush through it you can probably finish it in 3 hours or less, but you'd also miss a lot of the game and not have enough time to really let some of the deeper moments stew and process. 

Playtime might be the only potential drawback to some that aren't as invested into games like this. I 100% believe the game is worth its asking price. The labor of love and passion that went into this is on display in each scene. However, if you are not a fan of point-and-clicks (why are you here?), or are not sure you'll like the subject matter and abstractness, I might wait for a sale. 

Seriously though, this game is great. Check out primordia if you haven't, though I also suspect many of you will have already. 

TL;DR; If this even slightly seems to interest you, I highly recommend it.
developer_response:
What a beautiful, generous review! It means so much to all of us to hear from players; these are the connections that make the hard work of game development worthwhile.

A couple small notes for what they're worth: (1) for those curious about the quotes/references, there is an annotation mode (and commentary tracks), and replaying the game with notes/comments can extend the playtime a bit for folks so inclined; (2) for those who need hints, there is actually an integrated hint system, so ideally you don't need to tab out to an FAQ/walkthrough. :)

Thanks again so much. You made my day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132276974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1682456927}
review:
I'm not really sure how to judge Strangeland, to be honest. It's one of those games that has a story whose interpretation is mostly up to the player, so I can't exactly examine it by way of the conventions of traditional story-telling. The quality of the narrative will be determined differently by whoever plays it based on how they do or don't interpret the events that occur, so I really can't give you anything more than my general impressions as a basis along with just how the game functions as a game.

Strangeland is one of the latest games published by Wadjet Eye and the second game developed by Wormwood Studios after the excellent Primordia from nearly a decade before this game came out. It is the story of a man whose name we aren't given, but is referred to in the credits as 'The Stranger,' and he wakes up in a mysterious carnival, on a bunch of islands floating in an endless sky, that looks straight out of a metal album cover. Upon entering the Big Top, which is sentient and voiced by Mike Pollock doing what sounds like hilariously terrible stand-up routines, he encounters a woman committing suicide by throwing herself down a well and then reviving to repeat the action in an endless cycle shortly after. From there, he makes it his mission to find a way to stop her from doing this while attempting to figure out where he is and what's going on from the denizens of this place.

First of all, like Primordia being a huge shoutout to Beneath a Steel Sky, Strangeland very clearly has a lot of influence taken from Sanitarium, which is even directly referenced in a certain conversation. I mean, that was extremely clear to me just hearing lead VO, Abe Goldfarb, do his best impression of Frank Schurter, the lead VO of Sanitarium, and it was even further cemented the first time you get a phone call from yourself. Though, unlike Primordia, it doesn't feel like the entire plot was ripped from Sanitarium as that game only had a brief section in a carnival, which is where all of Strangeland takes place, and its main plot was about a corporation trying to hide the cure to a deadly virus with a subplot about the main character absolving himself of past trauma whereas Stangeland kind of hones in on the latter. As a result, Strangeland feels a lot more original and has its potential influences worked far better into the narrative. The story itself is more difficult to judge, so I'll just say that I enjoyed the tone and the atmosphere right up until the very end where it kind of got extremely corny in a way where it felt like the last paragraph was written by a teenager. Didn't ruin the whole game for me, and I'm not sure how I would have ended a story written like this, but it just felt extremely jarring given everything that had happened up to that point. I was also a little disappointed that there's only two ending choices where Primordia gave you like 6 or 7 different ending variations.

The presentation of Strangeland is definitely top notch. The background are some of the most beautifully drawn I've seen in an adventure game and the characters sprites are very crisp and highly detailed to the point where you can spot the minutia of facial expressions without the need for closeup, though there are still closeups in certain parts which are similarly stunning to look at. The VO, for the most part, is honestly a cut above the rest of Wadjet Eye's games. In the years they've been in operation, they've really nailed how to record and direct voice actors: everyone's audio sounds extremely clean even when there's vocal filters put over it and all of the voice actors embody their roles very well with many absolutely selling you on the drama of the situation.

For a world without a clear sense of logic, I was actually surprised by how much the puzzles seemed to make sense. When doing a game like this which has different rules from our reality, there's a fine line between maintaining the sense of surrealism and designing puzzles that a human brain could still reasonably interpret, and Strangeland absolutely rides that line. Now, that's not to say you'll never get stuck, but there is thankfully a really effective hint system in the form of calling yourself on the phone. If you ever don't know what to do, the you on the other end will nudge you in the right direction. It's extremely useful if you ever happen to accidentally miss an item or if you know what you need to do but aren't necessarily sure of where to star going about it. The environments and interactibles are thankfully very clear and readable so missing something is ultimately unlikely. I really don't have anything bad to say about the game design; the most I could is that a later area had an exit to the environment that wasn't made clear by the background art, but even then I think context clues will lead most players to find that exit and I was being a little too hasty.

I really did enjoy Strangeland, despite me not thinking the most of the story. It has gorgeous presentation, a great atmosphere, and enjoyable puzzles. I really couldn't ask for much more from an adventure game when so many can be unclear and/or frustrating. I know Wormwood are breaking from adventure games for their next release, but if they ever do decide to develop another, I would be excited to see what they have in store.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the lovely, detailed review! Always grateful for the support we get from our players.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980563875', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1681969838}
review:
Based on the final title card, clearly this game was a labor of love, but from a player's perspective this game is long on writing and short on discovery, even for a point-and-click. The game hints like you'll be discovering the 'real story' behind the metaphors, but either the writer loved the metaphors too much, or the real story is just genuinely too thin.

It doesn't outstay its welcome, which is good, but I was disappointed at the end, again, even as a fair-weather fan of this genre. Give it a pass unless you absolutely cannot get enough of these games.
developer_response: Sorry you didn’t enjoy it! Definitely not a game for everyone, though of course we wouldn’t complain if it somehow were. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984820498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1681629897}

author: {'steamid': '76561198325488646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1680691262}
review:
요즘 게임을 하다보면 분명 그레픽도 좋고 뭔가 할것도 만들어 놓았는데도
껍데기만 있다고 생각될때가 있는데,

그런 의미에서 이 게임은 게임이 무엇을 담아야 하는지 보여주는 작품이라고 생각된다.

이 게임은 고전게임의 불편한 부분을 몇가지 가지고 있지만,

글의 품질이 뛰어나며,
요즘 게임에서는 찾아보기 힘든 게임에 대한 철학이 있다는 점에 더 가산점을 부여하고 싶다.

거대콘텐츠 기업에서 pc같은 정체성정치를 추구하고, 지겨운 문화전쟁이 한참인 요즘,

정치적 선전이 아닌 순수하게 인간 내면의 문제에 대한 이야기를 훌룡하게 담아낸 이 게임이
너무나도 아름다워 보인다.
developer_response: 참으로 아름다운 리뷰이며, 텍스트가 여전히 아름답다는 우리의 뛰어난 번역가에 대해 많은 것을 말해줍니다. 매우 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053594112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1680638845}
review: Hra má i přes styl starých point and click her hutnou atmosféru. A i když jde celkem o umělecké dílo ve stylu psychologického horroru, tak hře bohužel chybí nějaké finální srozumitelné rozuzlení příběhu. Většina otázek zůstane nezodpovězeno a dialogy mi během hry nedávaly moc smysl. Na ukrácení času ale doporučuji.
developer_response:
Mnohokrát děkujeme za doporučení a za hraní naší hry! V závislosti na vaší trpělivosti si ji možná rádi přehrajete znovu s poznámkami a komentářem.

Obecně si myslím, že je to trochu ošidná hra na "překládání" (buď ji překládá sám hráč, nebo ji hraje v jednom z našich přeložených jazyků), i když samozřejmě i anglicky mluvící mají podobný zmatek. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000871950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1679545676}
review: This is a solid adventure game. I enjoyed the puzzles. They were interesting and fairly intuitive. The builtin hint system is nice but I didn't feel like I needed it more than a couple of times. I can see my grief in this character, which is a compliment to the writing. I lost someone important to me and beat myself up about it for a long time. I only say that to say this game's portrayal of that kind of grief is powerful and representative of my personal experiences. I won't say more to avoid spoiling the game or talking too much about myself but this game is great.
developer_response: I’m glad if connected with you in that way. I hope not only the grief, but also its reconciliation, had parallels with your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368799839', 'num_games_owned': 6110, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1679479655}
review:
이상한 나라의 엘리스 남자 성인버전
그로테스크, 고어한 장면들이 좀 있고 겜 내용이 명확하지 않은 부분이 많아 그런거 싫어하는 사람들은 알아서 거르자.
한글화는 매우 잘 되어 있어 내용이 추상적이고 은유적인데다 제목그대로 이상한 나라라서 한글 안되었으면 게임 초반에 바로 포기했을 거 같다.
호불호가 갈릴 거 같은데 난 재밌게 했음.

 - 도전과제는 1회차로 다 딸 수 있고 데드신 다 보기만 챙긴다면 까다로운 것도 없는 거 같음.
 - 개발사가 유저 및 유저 한글 패치에 매우 친화적이라서 맘에 듦. 이 회사 전작이 명작이라는데 언젠가 한글로 해봤으면 좋겠다.
developer_response:
친절한 말씀 정말 감사합니다! 나는 우리가 Strangeland에 사용한 버전보다 비로마자 알파벳 언어에 훨씬 덜 친숙한 AGS의 (훨씬) 오래된 버전으로 만들어졌기 때문에 Primordia를 한국어로 번역할 수 없을까 두렵습니다.

우리는 세계 최고의 자원 봉사 번역가를 보유한 축복을 받았습니다. 모든 번역(한국어 포함)에서 번역가와 긴밀하게 작업했으며 번역에 투입된 사랑과 노력의 양은 항상 분명합니다. 세상은 아름다운 사람들로 가득 차 있고 제가 게임을 만들 때 가장 좋아하는 부분은 그들과 연결되는 것입니다!

덧붙여서 거의 30년 전에 나는 내 PC에서 한국 RPG를 즐겼고(그리고 사랑했고)(지금은 이름조차 기억나지 않습니다), 재미교포 친구가 번역을 시켜줬습니다. 그래서 우리의 게임을 한국과 다시 공유할 수 있었던 것은 매우 자랑스러운 순간이었습니다! :)

(Google 번역이 이 문제를 너무 많이 엉망으로 만들지 않았으면 합니다!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998130886', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1679305319}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025372423', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1677450471}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978857000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1677804334}
review: Make more of these thoughtful experiences please.  I look forward future projects from all members of the team.
developer_response:
Means a ton to read even that short review.

The quick answer is that Strangeland was basically as deep as I can mine that particular vein of sorrow and hope in my own life. If the specific themes and exposition interest you, there is something I made *before* Strangeland: a section for the RPG Torment Tides of Numenera featuring a character named Inifere. He is a darker, less hopeful image of the same despair-paralysis, with similar elements of body-horror, disassociation, and personality fragmentation.

If you more just enjoyed *any* personal/philosophical/classical/humanist content in a point-and-click, you should try Primordia, which I wrote before Strangeland.

Finally, I'm hoping that Fallen Gods will be coming out pretty soon, but it's radically different. But sprung from the same place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110634737', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1677763692}
review: 간단하게 즐길만한 코즈즈믹 호러 어드벤쳐인데 스토리가 좀 많이 난해한게 단점
developer_response: 감사합니다! 원래 영어에서도 항상 까다로운 "텍스트"가 될 것이며, 자원 봉사 번역가가 훌륭하게 작업한 경우에도 번역이 더욱 까다로워질 수 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972434568', 'num_games_owned': 1945, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1677798006}
review:
Pros
-Incredible art-style
-Fantastic voice acting.
-Really interesting world and characters
-Engaging story
-Solid point and click puzzle design with a built in help system
-Dialog responses for almost all wrongly attempted actions and item combinations.

Cons
- No hot-spot reveal
- Locked to 40fps, apparently this is an AGS limitation but I could have sworn I've played several AGS games and other wadjet eye titles with higher frame-rates.

Overall highly recommended.
developer_response: Thank you so much -- it's particularly nice that you noticed some things like the variety of dialog responses. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030529924', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1703300729}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017550100', 'num_games_owned': 3387, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1676785884}
review:
哈，又是一个中年癌症丧妻之后发疯的老白男！感觉在point n click里面这种主角我已经见了三四个了。
所以，故事实际上并没有什么深度，结局也是为了有三个成就而勉强做了一点，不需要去深究。

出色的部分基本集中在配音，对白以及美术风格上。所以算是个中评。
有大概三个谜题一如既往延续着这个组让人摸不着头脑的逻辑，老毛病了。

未来似乎有一个不是pnc的rpg作品，期待一下。
developer_response: 感谢您试一试！

author: {'steamid': '76561198013874208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1676517670}
review: A one location point and click game that gives just enough about depression to have it reflect on one's own life. The joy of this game is the people you get to talk to. Writing is really good.
developer_response: Thank you so much -- that's exactly what I was trying for in the writing, so I'm glad it worked for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079495694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1675544831}
review: Most uncomfortable game I've played in a while, a dark tale with dark themes. So dark that at times it feels like the writer is pointing out every failure you ever had. That aside, it is a interesting game with surreal artwork and great writing, if not a little hard to understand the metaphors in places. I want to say it was enjoyable, but right now I feel emotionally wrung out. Best I can say is its an unhappy experience not to be missed, just not for fragile people.
developer_response:
Ha, it's more the writer pointing out every failure *he* ever had. :)

I hope at least you found some catharsis in the ending!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004064227', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1675442080}
review: A gloomy and eerie story about (not) dealing with death, loss, and regret. It has outstanding visuals, superb voice-acting, and a few seriously overcomplicated puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997105816', 'num_games_owned': 1267, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1675309712}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039381596', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1675132848}
review:
Not sure where do I even start with Strangeland...
Wormwood made a very difficult game, not in terms of difficulty itself, although change to a more classical point-n-click adventure difficulty was nice, I enjoyed the puzzles a lot, not to say Primordia puzzles were bad per say.
But story wise, hoo-boy, I didn't expect for an PnC game to hit this close to home, especially for someone who's been in depths of self-loathing and loss of loved family members. You went above and beyond with this one Wormwood, and especially you Mark, if I remember correctly that you are the one who wrote the story for this game.
I hope to see more works like these from you, thank you for giving us a game of this caliber and tackling such heavy topics. This is your best work yet in my opinion.
developer_response:
Thank you so much -- it means the world to hear that.

One of the oddest things about players' reactions to Strangeland is that folks who have experienced something like the voice on the phone or the Strangers' loss and despair have reactions like yours, but then among folks who *haven't* had such experiences, there are players who insist it's not a realistic depiction or that it would be too painful to experience for someone who's gone through it.  So it's always nice to read a review like yours!

Ultimately, the only stories I can tell are the stories in my own heart and head (whether about robots aspiring to humanity, love as a light through grief, or a selfish god clinging to his status). I'm glad when they find an audience, but they'd have to come out one way or another even without an audience! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972389049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1675079965}
review: What a mindfuck, Loved this gem, the premise grabbed me. The main character reminded me of Vincent from Ergo Proxy in a deranged Lovecraftian Kafakesque carnival limbo. The puzzles were well thought out and were never obtuse. If do you get stuck you can call the payphone for clues, which is a neat mechanic. Voice acting is mostly excellent but the broody writing felt slightly desperate a few times. The raven is hilarious
developer_response: Thanks! So glad you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067747282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1675054784}
review:
잘 만들긴 했습니다.

사실 Wormwood의 전작인 프리모디아를 보면 게임진행과 퍼즐부분은 딱 기대한만큼입니다. 흠잡을데 없다는거죠.
근데 이게 첫 한글 번역이라는게 참 미묘합니다. 프리모디아도 가볍게 할만한 게임이라고 할수는 없었고 배급사인 Wadjeteye의 라인업을 보면 이런게 하나쯤은 나와도 이상할건 없었지만 아무리 그래도 이건 좀... 너무... 인디스럽잖아요.
어떤 남자의 절망과 극복을 상징과 비유로 나타내는 심상은 엄청나게 창의적이라고 하긴 힘들지만 다른 사람들에게 입문작으로 추천할만한 이야기도 아닙니다. 그점에서 프리모디아가 먼저 번역되었어야 하는데...
아무튼 게임에 대해서 이야기하자면 트레일러에 나온걸 보면서 생각했을 그대로입니다. 주인공이 어떤 사건으로 절망해서 마음속에 기괴하고 비틀린 환상을 통해서 주변사람들과 자신을 특정한 형태로 투영한다는 내용입니다. 말하자면 2D이고 조금 더 잔인하고 징그럽고 우물로 추락하려는 여자의 엉덩이가 많이 나오는 사이코너츠죠.
이정도만 설명했지만 벌써 할 사람들이 많이 줄어드는게 보이는거 같지만 솔직히 만약 당신이 이 게임의 이미지와 트레일러를 보고 내용을 대충 예상하지 못했으면 문제가 있는겁니다.
전개는 제 취향이 아니었습니다. 게임에서 뭔가를 하면 계속 저를 까는데 물론 작중인물에게 한 말이고 이 행동은 현실에서 그가 택한 선택을 상징하는건 알지만 진행하려면 다른 선택지도 없는데 그걸 했다고 까니 불쾌하죠. 그래도 계속 할 정도로 기본적으로 게임이 재미있습니다. 
그 외 약간의 불만을 말하자면 우선 초반 주인공의 연기가 어색하게 들린다는 것, 성우분이 Wadjeteye에서 개발, 배급마다 등장하는 Abe goldfarb인걸보면 연기력 문제가 아니라 초반에 연기톤을 잡지 못했거나 애초에 개인의 머리속에서 혼잣말을 하는 스토리이니 그런 연기로 한걸수도 있겠지만 그래도 조금 거슬리긴 했어요. 그리고 두번째 불만은 한글번역이 약간씩 오역이 있다는겁니다. 1인번역이니 할수없긴 하지만 hint of gold light(희끗 보이는 금빛)를 금빛의 힌트라고 하는건... 뭐 진행에 문제가 있는것도 아니고 어렵고 잘 안쓰이는 단어들을 번역해주셨으니 그냥 사소한 불만이긴 하죠.
계속 단점만 말했지만 사실 장점이 더 많습니다. 도트 그래픽은 강렬하고 꼭 모든것을 이해하려 하지않고 분위기를 받아들이는 정도로만 해도 충분하고 AGS 엔진에 이런게 되나 싶은 연출도 강렬하고 심지어 제 취향이 아니라고 한 전개도 계속 진행하게 만들 정도로 좋은 스토리를 가지고 있습니다.
결론은 표지를 보고 흥미가 동했다면 추천할만한 게임입니다. 예술영화적인 뽕을 느끼고 싶거나 포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐를 자주 했으면 기분전환으로 도전해볼만 합니다.
developer_response: 감사! 아쉽게도 Primordia가 만들어진 AGS 버전에서는 한글 문자 집합이 우리가 지원할 수 있는 글꼴에 비해 너무 크기 때문에 기본적으로 한국어로 번역하는 것이 불가능합니다. 절름발이이지만 그렇게됩니다. :/ 심지어 Strangeland 번역을 하려면 다른 언어에서 사용하는 것보다 최신 버전의 AGS에서 별도의 빌드를 만들어야 했고 여기저기서 몇 가지 시각 효과를 변경해야 했습니다. 2023년에는 번역이 더 쉬울 것이라고 생각할 것입니다! (구글 번역기에 입력하니...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006364507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1674933050}
review: Good game, I actually like how short it is. Reminds me to dropsy but more in your face with the message and better paced. After Primordia I honestly expected more depth but I'm just happy to play another Wormwood game. Looking forward to Fallen Gods
developer_response:
Thanks so much!

I've aimed for depth with all of our games, but in different ways -- Primordia, I wanted the depth of a world that feels very expansive in time and space (even if you only explore a sliver of it); Fallen Gods, the depth comes from replayability, with every event offering so many paths through (with many options available only if you have certain items, followers, skills, etc.) that *mechanically* it feels like you're only scratching the surface in a given encounter; Strangeland, the depth is meant to come from the densely packed web of allusions and imagery, with elements that seem "random" fitting into place upon reflection, replaying, or checking out the commentary/annotations.

That said, the depth of Primordia and Strangeland is much more accessible. Strangeland began as a very small game inspired by the death of my grandparents, and over time all three of us made it grow and grow, but perhaps it is a little "ingrown" if that makes sense. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198182731018', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1698005908}
review:
One of the many things I love about Wadject Game or you can say Wadjet Eyes style of games is the variety of point-and-click games on their bucket list. Looking for a game based in a futuristic sci-fi setting, you got Technobabylon, looking for one set in the post-apocalypse environment, you got Shardlight. Essentially, most of those I've played range from being at least decent to amazing in their rights telling some interesting stories between them that doesn't feel like a copy. But, before I get ahead of myself in crediting the developer of Wormwood Studios for their reimagining of the game, let's talk about Strangleland.

Being a carnival horror theme, Strangeland is a great addition to the genre we don't see plenty of in the gaming industry, and this is coming from who is a sucker for anything based around the circus, funfair and performing arts. The phases I would use to simplify Strangeland, is it being a grim version of Alice in Wonderland, down to the mucky colour palette, creepy characters design who talk in 'gibberish' with a purpose, and the whole atmosphere being out of this world like I'm in another dimension. 

I love the expansion of cinematic wallpaper cutscenes that add gruesome and unsettling of certain scenes. The sound effects are spot on and the dialogue was the right amount of ominous and question marks moments without getting out of hand.

The storytelling on the other hand wasn't as much of a roller coaster ride. For me at least it wasn't too special, probably due to not relating to the main character's struggles with their[spoiler]dark depression after losing someone important to them.[/spoiler]

Anyone who cares more about the narrative in general than the visual should probably purchase this game for £6.00 or whenever it is on a discount as you probably won't gain much from it.

But this isn't me recommending this game largely on the storytelling, but more so on the creative imagery and presentation that it could be their own art museum.
developer_response: So glad you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969758175', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1674768960}
review:
From the creators of Primordia, Strangeland is a delightfully grotesque adventure game about pain, loss, grief, depression, and finally redemption.
Great atmosphere, music and voice acting. The puzzles are not that difficult, but there is a built-in hint system, if you get stuck. I used it one time, and it called me an idiot. 

10/10 would get depressed again
developer_response: Thank you so much for the lovely review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097355793', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1674513656}
review: Don't let the screens fool you, despite the interesting setting, this is a rather shallow and short game about a man haunted by the loss of his loved one (wow, how original). The story is uninteresting and paper thin, there are no twists or a big reveal at the end. The puzzles are very easy and some of them are recycled 1:1 from other titles. Not a bad game per se but since it's such a big disappointment after the excellent Primordia, I'm forced to give it a thumbs down.
developer_response: Sorry you didn't like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982079483', 'num_games_owned': 1293, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1673819229}
review:
I'm not 100% onboard with how the story resolved, but this point-'n'-click game goes places with the unsettling visuals and the writing. Most of the puzzles I was able to do without having to use a guide as well. There were a couple of puzzles where I just couldn't see the logic of it, but then after looking it up, I had that "Oh, duh!" feeling.

It's a good adventure game to spend an afternoon or evening on after work.
developer_response:
Glad you liked it! And many thanks for the review.

For me, that is the only way the story could resolve, and if you are morbidly curious as to such personal reasons, there's always the commentary/annotations mode. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197970237665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1672590623}
review:
[b][u]General Thoughts/Overview:[/u][/b]

TLDR: Meant to be dark and brooding, but comes off a little desperate. Still an interesting, if short, game. 

Strangeland is a simple if emo point and click. Built in the ‘golden age’ 90’s style it makes use of quite a few of the modern improvements to pnc’s but still suffers from a few of the pitfalls of the genre. It seems heavily inspired by I have no mouth yet I must scream and the darker elements of beneath a steel sky. 
You play as the stranger… in a dark carnival named Strangeland… I, of course, decided he’d be called Heinlein or Valentine or even Smith, and was immensely disappointed there were no references to this… Or if they were they were too subtle for me. Our stranger here is chasing a woman down a well… Literally in my case. In what seems to be a cycle of self destruction.

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
[list][*] The game sticks to its theme quite well. It shoots for dark and broody, and even if it seems a bit desperate at times, it pulls it off nicely. 
[*] The puzzles are simple enough to keep flowing, while esoteric enough that if you’re relatively new to point and click adventures they might pose a little challenge.
[*] The voice acting and dialogue is done tastefully, and add depth to the scenes and characters. These little extras build the world nicely. 
[/list]

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
[list][*] I don’t think this is a very tasteful take on mental illness, grief, or loss. It misses the mark often by moving into the dramatic over the hard truths we have inside, which I found eyerolling over engaging. 
[*] There are a few pixel hunting moments that are a staple downfall of the genre. Didn’t spot the hole in the tent? That’ll be one frustration please! Luckily the double click move, condensed scenes, and ability to skip most cutscenes make hopping around quick, so you can jump about and hunt… There’s also always hints, which the game doesn’t punish you for using. (I assume, I didn’t get an achievement for ‘no hints used’ so I’m guessing its ok.)
[*] The game boasts there is no way to fail etcetcetc, there are also no alternative routes, that I could find at least. It’s all good and well not having dead ends, but that only matters if you can solve problems in a multitude of ways. You can’t. So if you’re stuck it’ll end up as a rub things on other things fest until you find the right doodad to rub against the right thingyamjiggy. 
[/list]

[b][u]Suggested improvements:[/u][/b]

 [list][*] I’d have loved to see more dialogue options, more red herrings, more paths, more places, more solutions, and just more of everything, I guess. What we had felt good, adding some places and people to flesh the world out would really help grow the complexity of the world. Let 83 make more items, let them have effects in places, let us [i]explore[/i]. 
[*] Lean into the tight writing and characters to produce more organic moments. There was huge opportunity for some very interesting revelations here and it all seemed a bit… underwhelming. 
[*] Develop the ambiance. Strangeland has moments where it does unsettling exceptionally well, but it doesn’t do mundane well at all. A lot of animations are reused giving it a stock image feel. A few more motions would really help it. The odd shuffle in the strait jacket, varied wind, a few more motions from the characters around, all of these would give this world an even more unique and real feel. 
[/list]


[b][u]Overall Recommendation:[/u][/b]

This was a close one for me. The big problem I see is the pricing. Strangeland is well worth picking up, but I don’t think it’s worth half the money they’re asking for it. I have a little over 5 hours played, for 2 run through’s and a whole bunch of AFK eating time… That really isn’t value for money for something so short… But it is unique, interesting, and lovingly crafted.
Not for people with suicide triggers, carnival phobias, or who are easily disturbed.
For people with limited experience in point and clicks, people after a story heavy game, and people who like the grotesque. 
Overall I give this a thumbs up, but I recommend buying it when it’s heavily discounted. At half the price it is, Strangeland would be an absolute steal.
developer_response: Glad you liked it overall, and I appreciate the detailed feedback. Helpful for devs and players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069608679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1671866382}
review: A gorgeous, disturbing, atmospheric psychodrama that suffers from a few frustrating puzzles, a very short playtime (with little replayability), and pacing issues in its narrative. If it intrigues you, wait until it is on sale.
developer_response:
Sorry you had a bad experience with the game.

The replayability comes mostly from different puzzle solutions, paths, and dialogue options, along with the commentary/annotations mode.  But ultimately point-and-clicks (excluding the masterful QFG series) don't lend themselves as much to replayability.

I hope you have very happy holidays and better hunting elsewhere in the Steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078953742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1671654424}
review: If you love Sanitarium, you'll love Strangeland. The only problem is, strangeland only leaves you with a taster and not a full entre. The game is so short you can't help wishing there was more. My whole play through took 5 hours, and that was with frequent game pauses. The graphics are great, the voice acting is great, and the story is great. The puzzles are fun without being super challenging. I do not regret my purchase in the least. If you enjoy classic point and click adventures, buy Strangeland. Just know it will be a short thrill.
developer_response: Thanks so much! We did try to aim more for depth than length here, and to cut out a lot of the padding in many adventures (like backtracking, or slow walking speed, or lengthy dialogues). Still, it's a short game... but I'm glad you found it short but sweet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142188381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1671484112}
review:
Wicked and fun.  Strangeland isn't a long game but it feels full and heavy.  The puzzles are clever, the dialog is insightful and the art style works well.  Themes include depression, grief, suicide, and mental illness.  The game made me feel disturbed more than once - so be warned.  I loved the phone dynamic, with the cruel, helpful voice on the other side!  I also enjoyed the tarot elements and appreciated how the developers made minimal play locations evolve and change over the course of the game so it felt robust and complete.  Things became repetitive but strange and unfamiliar and it worked somehow.  Is this what madness feels like?

P.S.  I died a lot.  Like...a lot.
developer_response: So glad you enjoyed the strange journey -- and grateful you took the time to leave such a kind review!

review: 공교롭게도 C.S 루이스의 <헤아려 본 슬픔>를 최근에 읽고 이 게임을 하게 되었다. 사별을 겪은 남자의 지옥같은 머리 속에서 일어나는 이야기이다. 그리고 이 이야기의 마지막은 누군가에게 종교보다 더한 위안을 주게 될 것이다. 나는 게임이 어디까지 할 수 있는지 다시금 궁금해졌다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007144206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1654770947}
review:
Took me a while to write this review, but coincidentally I got this game not long after learning my childhood friend committed suicide. I had no idea of the concept this game is dealing with, I just saw a game published by WEG, so I bought it. And as it turns out, it really helped me understand what a mind of a person suffering with depression might look like, as I've never experienced it myself.

The dark and abstract themes were also a breath of fresh air, when it comes to point and click adventure games in general and I did enjoy playing it, albeit it might not be for everyone.
developer_response: This review means a lot. I'm so sorry to hear about your friend, and grateful that we could help in this small way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162473690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1670794874}

Karanlık teması ve rahatsız edici karakterleri mükemmel işlenmiş.(BAYILDIMMM). Sanatsal grafikler ve seslendirmeler konusuna gelecek olursak yaratıcı ekip gerçekten harika iş çıkarmış.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201096703', 'num_games_owned': 964, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1672709427}
review:
Ölmeden önce bu oyunu oynamış olduğum için çok mutluyum ...


Oyunu çok beğendiğim için, önce normal sonra da geliştiricilerin yorumlarını içeren haliyle olmak üzere, iki defa oynadım. Nelerden ilham aldıklarını, nelerden alıntı yapıp nelere referans verdiklerini görmek istedim. Bilmediğim pek çok şey öğrendim, bu da oyun deneyiminin yanında ekstradan mutlu etti.


Strangeland, çok katmanlı bir oyun. Bu yönüyle ilk bakışta İlahi Komedya'yı andırdığını söyleyebilirim. Nasıl ki orada ilerledikçe Cehennem, Araf ve Cennet ile karşılaşılıyorsa, Strangeland'de de ona benzer bir mantık var. Aynı şekilde sembollerin de çok önemli bir yer tuttuğunu söylemek yanlış olmaz.

Ve tabii ki, o görür görmez insanı çarpan ismi düşününce... Yapımcılar doğrudan doğruya [i]"yabancılaşmayı vurguluyoruz"[/i] diye bağırmak istemişler, şeklinde algıladım. Elbette ki "yeni bir şey değil bu" diyebilirsiniz, ne de olsa modern ve post-modern birçok eserin ana teması olan bir konu. Ama bu kadar etkileyici örneğine rastlamak zor. Bitirdikten sonra "Keşke bu oyunu ben yapmış olsaydım" dedim. 


Strangeland, felsefik bir oyun. Karakterimiz neden orada olduğunu ve etrafta ne olup bittiğini de anlamaya çalışıyor tabii ki, ama esas meselesi kendini araması. Ama aynı zamanda da "kendini görmeye bile" tahammülü yok... Bu mükemmel bir çelişki örneği. Biz de bu arayış yolunda ilerlerken attığımız her adımda, altından anlamlar fışkıran pek çok şeyle karşılaşıyoruz. Bir şey size tuhaf, saçma veya anlamsız mı geliyor? Onu bir kenara itmeyin, aksine anlamaya çalışın, çünkü o aslında sizin ilerleyebilmeniz için bilinçli olarak konulmuş bir engel. Oyunun bulmacalarına bu yönden yaklaşınca, bana tıpkı mükemmel bir kitabın içinde kaybolmuşum hissini verdi.


Strangeland, sembolik bir oyun. Bir yerlere gitmek için sürekli ağzının içinden yürüyerek geçtiğimiz o palyaço, etraftaki kuzgunlar, yaşlı ve bilge bir adam diye tanımlayabileceğim başka bir karakter, size tarot kartları seçtirip falınıza bakan kişi, roller-coaster yolculuğu, ve elbette ki [i]maskeler[/i] ... Bunların her birinin kendince anlamları var, bazılarının iç içe geçmiş birden fazla anlamı var ve hepsi sizin tarafınızdan keşfedilip anlaşılmayı bekliyor. Yapımcılar ilk başta oyunu normal bitirip bütün bu alt anlamları ve alt metinleri 2. oynayışta keşfetmemizi önermişler, açıkçası onlarla aynı fikirdeyim. Hem ikincisinde ortama ve atmosfere alışmış olacağınızdan iyice bir sindirmiş olursunuz, hem de ilk başta çok fazla bilgiye maruz kalmak oyunun "oyun" olmasından alacağınız zevki öldürebilir.


Son olarak... Strangeland, maalesef ki özensiz bir çevirinin kurbanı olmuş bir oyun. Gördüğüm hataları burada tek tek ekran görüntüsü alıp bir albüm halinde paylaşmayı da bilirdim, ama o çok hedef göstermek gibi olacağından ayıp olur ve yakışık almazdı diye düşündüm, vazgeçtim. Bunun yerine sadece oynamak isteyen kişilere İngilizce oynamalarını tavsiye etmekle yetiniyorum. Yani Türkçe çeviri var diye mutlu bir şekilde indirerek hemen oyuna dalayım diye heves etmeyin, o heves kursağınızda kalır ve üzülürsünüz. Sıkıntı ne derseniz, inanın hangi birini sayacağımı bilemiyorum. Bazı cümleler küçük harfle başlıyor. Bazı cümlelerde hiçbir neden yokken büyük harf başlanarak yazılmış kelimeler bulunuyor. Özne yüklem uyumsuzlukları, anlatım bozuklukları... Yanından 45976298350 kere geçtiğimiz kuyunun "pekâlâ" diye çevrilmesi... İyi niyetlerle yola çıkılmış olabilir, ama kötü bir çeviri okuyan kişinin oyuna olan ilgisini bir anda sıfıra indirebilir. Yapımcılar eğer yazılan incelemeleri okuyorlarsa, öneri olarak bir proof reader bulmalarını ya da en başta çeviri işlerini tek bir kişi yerine bir ekibe emanet etmelerinin daha doğru olacağını söylemek isterim. Sonuçta ekip işinde insanlar birbirlerinin yanlışlarını görüp düzeltirler ve ortaya çıkan işin kalitesi artar.


Aşağıdaki paragraf bir miktar hafif spoiler içeriyor, bakıp bakmamak sizin bileceğiniz iş, sadece biraz fikir vermesi açısından ekleyeceğim.


Pastanın üzerindeki çilek niyetine, oyunda ciddi manada beğendiğim ve ilgimi çeken bazı ufak tefek detayları paylaşmak istiyorum:

[list]
[*] Lacan'dan bahseden bir ağustos böceğinin varlığı :)
[*] Atıcılıkla ilgili bulmacanın alternatif çözüme sahip olması (herkesin hız ve isabet yeteneği mükemmel olacak diye bir şey yok, akıl yürütme ile farklı çözüm bulunabiliyor olması çok iyi)
[*] Çeşitli din ve mitoloji referansları + bazı oyunlardan esinlenmeler :)
[*] [spoiler]Geçmiş, şimdiki zaman ve gelecek hallerimizi simgeleyen[/spoiler] 3 kişinin, Ali Poyrazoğlu'nun Davet şiirini anımsatması :)
[*] Ve nispeten dikkat çekmeyen bir noktada yer aldığı için birçok oyuncunun gözden kaçırdığını düşündüğüm şu şahane sözler beni benden aldı:

[spoiler][b][i]"The world is a masquerade. 
Faces, costumes, voices - - all pretend.
We all wish to appear as we are not,
We deceive ourselves,
And in the end, we do not even recognize ourselves."[/i][/b][/spoiler]
[/list]

Yazıyı fazla uzatmamaya çalıştığım halde bunu pek de başaramadığımı üzülerek görüyorum. Ama aslında anlatmak istediklerimin belki %40'ını ancak anlatabildim. :) Paragrafları mümkün olduğunca yalın tutarak heyecanımdan ve sevgimden bahsetmek yerine nesnel şekilde incelemeye çalıştım. Fakat bundan ileri gitmek de bu yazıyı inceleme olmaktan çıkarıp simgeler, semboller, alıntılar, mitolojik referanslar ... üzerine aşırı spoiler içeren bir metne dönüştürürdü ki, o da hiç hoş olmazdı. O tür şeyleri herkesin, daha doğrusu merak edenlerin kendi kendilerine keşfetmesi daha doğru olur.


Son (Bu sefer gerçekten son :D ) olarak, geçmiş doğum günü hediyem olarak gönderen arkadaşım @ Russell 'a teşekkür ederim, gerçekten çok mutlu oldum ve umduğumdan daha çok beğendim *-*
developer_response:
Güzel inceleme için teşekkür ederiz.

Çeviri deneyiminiz için üzgünüm. Gönüllü bir çabaydı. Bazı dillerde (özellikle İspanyolca, bir dereceye kadar Fransızca ve Almanca), çevirinin doğruluğunu ve stilini gözden geçirebiliyorum, ancak bunu Türkçe için yapamadım. Sonuç olarak, *herhangi bir* çeviriye sahip olduğumuz için minnettarız -- bu da en azından oyunu bir şekilde oynanabilir hale getirebilir -- ancak çeviride bu sorunların olması çok kötü.

author: {'steamid': '76561199042000246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1670734897}
review:
A short, but weirdly interesting little puzzle game.  It had a lot of flavor, great voice acting, and I love the built in hint system.  Don't have to consult the internet if you get stuck.  It was a real exploration of the character's broken psyche and trauma.  Your character spends the whole game wandering around in a straight jacket.  Worth picking up on sale.

I might have preferred the hand drawn animation without the pixelation, but that's a stylistic choice.
developer_response: Glad you liked it! Thank you so much for leaving a review, makes a big difference for indie devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059894754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1669863296}
review:
미사여구 가득한 대화나 시적인 문장들, 신화적 요소의 연관성 등등
어려운 내용밖에 없는 것 같지만 이해 못 해도 상관없다. 그저 분위기를 즐기는 것이 재미있다.
곰팡내나는 자기혐오를 즐기는 나 같은 사람에게는 나름 잘 맞는 작품.
developer_response: 매우 감사합니다! 혜원님의 번역으로 한국 플레이어들이 저희 게임을 더 많이 이용할 수 있게 되어서 정말 다행입니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013955888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1669754018}
review:
Ok, I'll be honest : Strangeland is not my favourite Wadjet Eye game. Not by a long run. Still, the art direction is great (that's what drew me in), it is extremely well written (and the french translation is pretty good) and I found the puzzles enjoyable, not too easy, not too hard either (except that "wanton one"... I had to "call for help" ;). The game could have used more environments and interactions though.

The reason this game does not come close to my favourite Wadjet Eye games (My top 3 being Blackwell Unbound, then Gemini Rue, then The Shivah) is the fact that in a way it feels a bit too... "cliché", for lack of a better word. It is clear from the beginning that the "hero" is inside his psyche, and all the classical symbolisms are present : mirrors, black dogs, light vs dark... Even the ending (the "best" one, which I consider as the true ending) is cliché as hell.

Also, while the writing is exceptional, I felt that sometimes the best lines were forced. I was like "Ok, that's quite a thought provoking line there, but could it have been drought with a little more subtlity ?". It's like having an exceptional sauce with your dish, but all over the plate. It's good so it's okay, but it's meant to be used with just the right amount and at the right moment.

But overall, I recommend this game. I spent a full evening playing it (almost) from start to finish and I don't regret a single euro spent. While I still wait for a game that will move me as much as Blackwell Unbound, I can't deny that Wadjet Eye is still making the best point and clicks nowadays. I've still got a bunch to play (Unavowed, Resonance, Technobabylon and Shardlight) and I'll be sure to buy their next games !
developer_response: Glad you liked it overall, and appreciated the French translation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121621504', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1708205622}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986483347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1668034428}
review: I really enjoyed all other point & click adventures published by Wadjet Eye Games that I have played so far, but Strangeland completely failed to impress me. Although it is obvious that the devs intended the game to be mystical and strange, because it is meant to play inside the mind of mentally ill person, I feel that they have pushed this "strangeness" so far that absolutely nothing in this game makes any sense -- dialogs, characters, puzzles and endings included. I've had some personal experience with mental illness my, so I can somewhat relate to the protagonist's visions, but still the game seems like a random collage of weird, non-connected ideas with no actual plot that's connecting them. I'm sorry, but even when you're trying to dive into the mind of a broken man, you still have to put some effort into connecting the dots that make up the story, because even for mentally ill people, their thoughts make sense in their way of viewing the world....
developer_response:
Sorry you didn't enjoy it.

For what it's worth, however, the content is not disconnected or random; it is specifically grounded in our own mental experiences. It may not map onto how you've experienced despair or loss, but it's not like we were just throwing paint at a wall based on speculation about how a broken person might perceive the world. There's little sense dragging out a game you don't like, but if you play it with commentary/annotations on, the connections, themes, and origins are discussed at length. Ultimately that can't fix an experience you didn't enjoy, but it might assuage your concern that somehow this is based on a misunderstanding of how someone else's mind might seem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085577509', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1668901040}
review: Very good. No, not as good as Primordia, nothing is, but still really great. Art direction is impeccable, though the puzzles are very easy and so this time around it's more like an interactive novel.
developer_response:
Thanks so much! Hard to balance puzzle difficulty; I thought at least relative to nu-ventures we had pretty robust puzzles, and we still get reviews saying they're impossibly hard... alas. The woes of adventure game design!

Anyway, glad you liked the game, and enjoyed Primordia, too!

author: {'steamid': '76561199381148057', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1668422444}
review: 포인트앤 클릭에다가 미스터리 장르 제일 좋아해서 이런 게임 있으면 다 찾아서 해보는 편인데 이 게임은 뭐라고 해야하지...다른 포인트 앤 클릭 장르에 비해 ㅈ같음. 일단 가장 처음 사격게임하는거부터 판정이 어떻게 되는지 모르겠음 똑같은데 쏴도 어떨때는 되고 어떨때는 안됨.  그리고 주인공 이속도 답답하게 느림. 한글화 수준은 엄청 좋음. 번역하기 까다로운 것들이 있었는데 잘 번역되어 있는거 같음. 그런데 내 취향은 아닌거 같음.
developer_response:
더 마음에 들지 않으셨다니 정말 죄송합니다! 당신이 그것을 환불할 수 있기를 바라지만, 그렇지 않다면 몇 가지 제안:

- 반사 신경으로 슈팅 게임에서 이기려는 것이 아닙니다. 다른 방법이 있습니다.
- 두 번 클릭하면 즉시 방을 나갈 수 있으므로 걷는 속도는 실제로 관련이 없습니다.
- 그렇지 않으면 이 게임과 다른 포인트 앤 클릭 게임 간의 차이점에 도움이 될 수 있는 옵션 메뉴에 게임 방법에 대한 정보가 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296255192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1666911449}
review:
An incredible dark and nightmarish story which took 4.2 hours to complete. 
I loved every second of it. One thing i would suggest for future games would be to try and include as much replay value to the games. I am not sure I will play this any more than the first playthrough due to how short it is. 

But thank you for itching my itch - a Gem for this genre.
developer_response:
Thanks so much for the kind review!

We tried to achieve replayability with multiple puzzle solutions and a somewhat non-linear path (by finding new solutions, it is kind of interesting, maybe, to see how far you can get down certain puzzle chains without doing things that seemed "required" in your first run).  There are also some decision points that mildly affect the plot and gameplay throughout (e.g., the tarot reading and how it affects later dialogue and puzzles).

But I think the biggest thing you can do on a second run is turn on commentary and annotation mode. Obviously that depends on being someone who enjoys commentary, but if you do, there is *a lot* of it that you can choose to listen to, and the annotation mode has on-screen text explaining the references in the dialogues and imagery. Most players who have tried it said it made for a different experience and overall a richer one because you can compare your own interpretation to the original goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076689222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1665795727}
review:
Sometimes people think that being able to anticipate something happening in a story is a sign that it's a bad story. I disagree, sometimes it's delightful to turn to your friend in the movie theater and whisper that the guy walking backward through the woods is about to get axed moments before the red light and screeching musical sting. I think the smallest components of a story are these commonly understood metaphors or symbols. Like arranging chords makes new songs out of familiar sounds. Like arranging syllables creates a conversation and bridges the gaps between us. This is a careful arrangement of cliches and references which tells a story you know.

Now that my urge for purple prose has been satisfied; this game has fun voice acting, beautiful pixel-art, and fantastic (in every way) characters. The game has really smart mechanical convinces that never irritates or annoys. The puzzles are intuitive and I never had to refer to an outside source to solve the puzzles. The writing is filled with clever allusions but is not overwrought. I strongly recommend this game.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind words -- I share your view on twists. I like them a lot, but for most of human history they were not really a key part of stories at all; stories were familiar, and the storyteller might gloss it, but the basic course was predictable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960282796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1666124650}
review: This is a profoundly wonderful Point and Click game, and it's only problem is it's too short (but worth every penny). If you've played and enjoyed Tormentium this will be right up your alley. It's a beautiful and bittersweet story which shouldn't be missed by fans of the genre. - A couple little easter-eggs/facts I noticed in the game was that the voice actor for the clown did a bunch of work on the English dub of Berserk, and there is also some name dropping that Wheel of Time fans will catch. - Regardless this game is highly recommended!!
developer_response: So glad you enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025103501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1666108548}
review:
When I was 19-24-ish, I was obsessed with the dark and mythological Vertigo comics. I thought they were the deepest most profound thing ever written. But when I read them now, the allegories, mythologising and psychological navel-gazing just doesn't connect with me anymore. I think me 15 years ago would have adored this game.

So there is a hell of a lot to like here. The art is striking and at times very disturbing to look at. The in-game age-warning before entering the carnival is very appropriate, as this one is definitely not for kids. 

Puzzle-design was good, but the smaller number of locations and inventory made it relatively easy. Although it felt short, it was priced appropriately so I don't count a short duration as a negative. One puzzle was a bit of a struggle for me due to my hearing difficulties, but luckily the designers included a helpful 'hint-line' within the game itself, which is thematic and helps keep you in the game rather than looking up external walkthroughs (which always spoil too much and ruin the immersion). 

The story really digs into allegory and symbolism. If you're the kind of person who reads Jung and obsesses over the hidden meanings of Neo's apartment number, then you'll probably enjoy poring over the oblique references in this game. You'll stroke your beard and whisper, yes, this is very deep. 

I'm being harsh. This is a very well-executed adventure game of this genre. It delivered exactly what was advertised, and I was compelled to keep playing to the end. I absolutely appreciate the passion of the writing/design team and the quality of the execution, so I gotta give this a (soft) recommendation for people who like this kind of thing, and for me 15 years ago.
developer_response: Appreciate the review -- which strikes me as fair and thoughtful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058619873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1665915591}
review:
Bereits die Screenshots von "Strangeland" lassen viel Raum für Spekulationen darüber, was einen konkret erwartet. Und ich sage euch: Ganz egal, was ihr gedacht habt - es ist anders.

Was lässt sich sagen, ohne zu viel vorweg zu nehmen?

Der Artstyle ist wunderschön morbide. Die Atmosphäre wird sehr eindrucksvoll aufgebaut und durch optimal platzierte Sound-Effekte getragen. Streckenweise kommt ein beklemmendes Gefühl auf, denn die Thematik und der Umgang mit dieser sind auf eine besondere Art umgesetzt. Nicht selten erwarten einen etwas abgedrehte Dialoge und minimal verstörende Grafiken.

Die Rätsel sind in den meisten Fällen gut lösbar und haben eher selten Frustpotenzial, auch wenn natürlich hier und da Kopfzerbrechen dazu gehört.

Zusammenfassend lässt sich also Folgendes sagen:
Wer ein kurzweiliges Point&Click Adventure im Pixel-Look mit leicht beklemmender Atmosphäre und einer recht ernsten Thematik sucht, ist hier auf jeden Fall an der richtigen Adresse.
developer_response: "Ganz egal, was ihr gedacht habt - es ist anders." Ich kann mir keine schönere Zusammenfassung vorstellen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065867547', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1665909915}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970909538', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1665872665}
review:
Very nice pixel artwork and atmosphere and interesting themes of loss, depression etc.

As a point and click game it's good. You can never get yourself properly stuck, and the answer can usually be deduced. It is possible to miss some achievements since some parts of the game permanently change, which is why I needed to play through a second time.

I played with the annotations on the second time, which basically tells you what all the references are in the dialogue. I basically hadn't understood the story at all, although it dropped some hints, it was never clear to me. Almost all of the dialogue is allegorical and referencing Norse mythology, Biblical mythology, Hebrew mythology, ancient poems or plays, Greek and Roman works, Edgar Allen Poe, plus all manner of obscure references.

Nothing is ever said to you in plain English, so from the point of view of the player it's like every character spews random words for no reason. A lot of the allusions and references are very indirect and made in a way that you basically would have to be told what is being referenced, even if you knew the source material. The author seems to think the more references the better, as every line in this game is a reference to something.

Nonetheless, I did still like the game, even if the narrative exposition was a bit lacking. If it had been better, then I would have cared more about the woman and my own fate.
developer_response: Thank you so much for your thoughtful review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119688777', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1665806087}
review:
[h1]At-A-Glance:[/h1]
[b]Game type:[/b] Adventure
[b]Genre(s):[/b] Psychological horror
[b]Art:[/b] Picture-perfect 90s style
[b]Length:[/b] 3-4 hours
[b]Pace:[/b] Medium-paced
[b]Tags:[/b] Surreal, nightmare, great soundtrack, gorgeous art, allegorical
[b]Computer requirements:[/b] Low-end


[h1]Notes:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] So first and foremost - I don't play adventure games. I've watched enough episodes of [i]Ross's Game Dungeon[/i] to be largely turned off on the entire genre. I don't think I've played one all the way through since I was in fifth grade when adventure games were big before computers got good. So, please keep in mind my thoughts are from someone who isn't familiar with the genre and was going into it somewhat skeptically. However, [i]Strangeland[/i] was chosen as one of October's games for the [i]Watch Out for Fireballs![/i] podcast, and I figured "hey, their games are always interesting regardless of appeal, so let's try this".
[*] From what I remember as a kid in elementary school through the 90s, this game does fantastically at capturing the style of 90s adventure games without the moon logical puzzles or frustration of locking yourself out of the ending. This made me willing to experiment way more, as I knew I could try whatever nonsense I came up. This rewards the leaps that lots of adventure games need.
[*] Inject this style of HR Giger/Zdzisław Beksiński artwork directly into my veins (and boy do some of the cutscenes of the woman really nail that). Visuals are the power of adventure games, and every scene in [i]Strangeland[/i] is itself a painting. [spoiler]Darkland and the decayed husks of the dead people(?) after the Dark Thing is let out[/spoiler] deserve particular mention.
[*] Awesome voice acting. I felt that The Stranger in particular hit the perfect blend of believable and "clueless adventure game protagonist". Murmur's voice actor deserves a BIG shout-out; I want him to narrate an audiobook.
[*] The soundtrack is a sublime 80s-ish horror movie type of synth.
[*] The highly allegorical nature of this game is pretty well-trod through media like [i]Jacob's Ladder[/i]. While I'm not burnt out on psychological horror that takes place [spoiler]in the protagonist's mind[/spoiler], I think some of [i]Strangeland[/i]'s puzzles and topics are heavy-handed. The Chorus's self-awareness of being the Chorus was hilarious, whereas Eitri and Fimbul Fambi were rote. I think I'd love Wormwood's next game (and I do hope they have a "next game") to have more of the Chorus's style of self-parody but still being creepy about it - there's a lot of mystery there. The style of humor where you're laughing at jokes that are mean to you is something that could work perfectly in this kind of game (which the Clown Head also hit).
[*] At $15 USD, I think the price is a little steep, but I like being put out of my gaming comfort zone - so for me, it was worth it. I can't really say how it compares to other games of the genre, but I saw it as going to see a long movie. And it was worth it!
[/olist]
developer_response: Thanks for the kind words -- and for leaving the review that got us to 500!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970504673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1665603382}
review:
I could write an entire dissertation on Strangeland. It deserves high praise and ranking within its genre.
The art stands on its own (extremely detailed, gross, and beautiful). The writing, and gameplay are woven together perfectly. The voice acting adds so much, and is good. 

The themes of suicide, death, self-loathing, loss are portrayed in a way that I did not think possible. Heavy moments are given levity with clever humor. That's how well written the game is. It never felt like TOO much for me to handle. It is paced very well and does not overstay its welcome.

I tend to click anything and everything multiple times when playing p&c games, I believe the devs knew players would do this. Within the 1st 10min or so I ending up pissing off a giant cauldron. I asked it to make me something repeatedly, trying to exhaust all dialogue options. He made me something alright, dead. So I embraced the darkness, and began finding
various ways to end my life. Apparently there is an achievement for this LOL

"Every Monster, was a Man first". Psychological Horror is one of my favorite types of Horror. Working in corporate for a long time, the idea of the masks we wear I found to be very intriguing. How well does your own family/friends/coworkers know you, how well do you know yourself? Humanity and our history have proven just how horrific we all are. We tell ourselves comforting lies while knowing the brutal darkness of the truth makes our lies necessary. The cicada(?) was a neat addition the idea of evolving/understanding the horror inside us. I digress! (so much to discuss)

I very much look forward to what these developers do next. What a unique ride from start to finish!
developer_response: Thank you so much for these well-woven and generous words. Means the world to know that a game that came from our hearts (and heads and hands!) has connected with players in this way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970836082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1665165101}
review:
I played through Strangeland at launch and never got around to writing a review, but I just returned to it for a playthrough with the annotation mode active so I figured now was as good a time as any to do so.

(I'll just start what's probably going to be a rambling gathering of my thoughts more than anything else with my summary that it's a great game and I fully recommend it to anyone looking for a darker adventure game to play. Beyond here lies my rambling.)

Strangeland is one of the most thought provoking, well written point and click adventures I've played. It's filled with symbolism and woven throughout with various literary references, yet it manages to walk the line of making a coherent and enjoyable experience if lacking familiarity with much of the source material it calls upon while enriching that experience if you identify it. Several of the references went over my head until I played the annotation mode (which is a great addition) and while some of the dialogue related to those moments felt cryptic on my first playthrough, it wasn't detrimental to my enjoyment or understanding of the game. The major themes which are more crucial to understanding the stranger's past are more overt and repeated multiple times, yet still it manages to avoid feeling repetitive. It doesn't feel like the game is beating you over the head with these references in so much as it's reminding you of their importance to what's going on with the stranger, which often feels like a gut punch even if it's something you already picked up on. I'm trying to avoid spoilers but I thought it was masterfully written.

The presentation is great. Voice acting is stellar, as it always is with Wadjet adjacent games to the point where I think it's expected now and something I often take for granted. The artwork and overall atmosphere is something else. Like something Giger could have dreamt up at the height of a fever after staying up too late playing Amiga games. The game is *extremely* dark and all of the elements come together to punctuate that so well.

If I do have a criticism it would be that the game world feels rather small. It being a fairly short game doesn't bother me as much, but this was more the feeling of the scale of physical space in the world, not so much the number of locations but the feeling of proximity I think. I feel like this is something a lot of adventure games avoid with maps or other navigation aids to provide the illusion of scale, and maybe it was compounded with the QoL of how fast it is to get around; it's extremely fast to move from one side of the game world to the other. Perhaps the smaller scale is by design but it was one of the things which I found off-putting.

Really I'm nitpicking though because overall I loved the game. Primordia was something special and Wormwood Studios proved themselves again with this offering, I really look forward to anything else they put out in future.
developer_response: Thank you so much for this lovely review. For me, making games is always about a push from within (the need to release the worlds and stories boiling over inside) and a pull from outside (the desire to build a connection with players through shared experiences and thematic resonance). Strangeland was a particularly personal story, so it means a great deal to know that the internal need to create succeeded in achieving external connections with players!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994242898', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1622019647}
review:
Declaration of bias: one of the VAs is a college friend of mine. 

THAT HAVING BEEN SAID

This game is incredible. It's a freeform nightmare trip through grief and loss in a way that a traditional narrative wouldn't allow. Furthermore, the nerds in charge have a love or literature and myth that just oozes out of the writing with every step and enriches the whole experience. Good, loving nerds. Not like the kind who start arguments over D&D rules or Marvel casting choices. 

The devs are great people, incredible friendly and kind and they deserve all of your money. Surrender all earthly possessions to "Strangeland"
developer_response: What a wonderful review to read. Thank you so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047769151', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1663093111}
review: Absolutely gorgeous experience. While it is a bit on the shorter side, the art, voice acting and writing is all a step up from primordia (which still nailed all those aspects). The music is still good but the art and added animation is really next level. I sincerely hope they put as much work into the art of their next title, but I can imagine making a longer game with this kind of detail being a enormous task. Well worth playing as long as you can handle the strange.
developer_response:
Thank you so much! It's inspiring to us as developers to receive such kind words (first what you said about Primordia, then this).

We certainly hope to keep improving on our craft with each game, though we move at a very glacial pace. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197962164463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1662653882}
review: Excellent point and click adventure in an esoteric and otherworldly setting. I very much appreciated the games references to classic literature whilst putting their own unique spin on it. The game is heavily focused around depression and doesn't shy away from any aspect of it which can be uncomfortable if you yourself or anyone you know has suffered with the condition. Well worth playing.
developer_response: Thank you so much for the kind words! I’m glad you enjoyed the game and its allusions and themes—fair warning you gave too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061265018', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1662336685}
review:
[h1]Recorremos a símbolos para lidar com os problemas da vida.[/h1]

Essa frase resume o que [i]Strangeland[/i] é, tanto na sua experiência de jogo como a experiência de seu desenvolvimento, como os designers revelam quando ativa o "Modo Comentário." Uma experiência surreal que serve símbolos e mais símbolos para retratar o mundo mais complexo e inexplorado da humanidade, o templo interno que abriga nossas mentes.
 
Com uma arte que casa o frio industrial com o calor orgânico, [i]Strangeland[/i] provoca o arrepio sensorial, transportando o tato do jogador para esse mundo híbrido, o convidado a se sujar também dessa união matrimonial entre a carne e o ferro. Mas a arte divide seu lugar de destaque com a excelente trilha sonora e incrível dublagem das personagens que se apresentam nesse circo de horrores dessa terra estranha.

Entretanto, não se pode aclamar tanto para a narrativa e os quebra-cabeças. De início, os obstáculos em [i]Strangeland[/i] são mais satisfatórios devido a sua natureza aberta, mas acabam se tornando mais lineares e simples durante o progresso do jogador.
A narrativa por si não é mal, mas também não arrisca em inovar. A coletânea de símbolos oferecem grande descarga emocional, mas tal leitura pode se igualar a experiência de ler um dicionário em busca do significado e poder de uma palavra, outro símbolo que exerce poder sobre nossas experiências humanas, especialmente quando se reconhece os símbolos antes da história os convocar para invocar emoções. Portanto, a narrativa pode-se tornar uma soma simples de matemática, onde se vê 2 + 2 e se espera 4, e o jogo não subverte essa lógica, gerando nenhuma surpresa.
Porém, isso não significa que [i]Strangeland[/i] conte uma história ruim, não. Personagens e, principalmente, frases irão ficar com jogador após completar o jogo. Esses símbolos comunicados, novamente, por uma excelente dublagem poderão até mesmo encontrar espaço nas paredes do palácio mental dos jogadores, sendo referenciados futuramente quando a vida apresentar novos problemas para eles.

Em resumo, [i]Strangeland[/i] é uma experiência surrealista espetacularmente apresentada e bem construída, mesmo que não fuja dos moldes fundamentados do gênero. Moldes esses que fazem um coral fenomenal com as vozes dos incríveis dubladores somadas com as nossas próprias vozes mirabolantes, habitantes de nossas próprias terras estranhas internas.
developer_response: Lindo. Uma resenha verdadeiramente poética. Justo em suas críticas, generoso em seus elogios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110593446', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1662309698}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999529469', 'num_games_owned': 2573, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1640576588}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128765641', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1653860127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198143548486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1661028350}
review:
It´s different from the other Wadjet Eye games, alot darker yet not unfamilar in style.

They even managed to fit in even more references and anecdotes than in Shardlight.

For me it held the same amount of Depth that Shardlight did, Simple one the surface but stretching so far deeper and i freely admit that most of the anecdotes to the bible and the names of the characters refering to them went over my head the first playthrough.

I will remember this game as a gem in the serious of the Wadjet Eye games that i will never regret to have stumbled upon.

I will close my review with a genuine thanks to the developers at Wadjet Eye:

Thanks for making these awesome games the amount of thought and dedication you put into them is simply insane. As i mentioned i played Shardlight regularly and with commentary the choices the decisions the designs you guys went over and Strangeland too all the references to ancient texts, the greeks it blows my mind of how much thought is compressed into such a little thing. Really genuinely Thanks for developing these gems as a team. Im sure that im speaking for alot of your playerbase when i say that we deeply appreciate the dedication you given your games over all these years.
developer_response:
Thank you so much! We are grateful for players’ support and encouragement. 

It’s fascinating how WEG has published games by so many developers (Primordia and Strangeland are ours, Resonance was Vince, Gemini Rue was Josh, Shardlight was Francisco) and yet maintain a very strong shared “brand.” Part of that is the shared voice cast, part of it is the nature of the engine (AGS) and genre. But it’s still a neat thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052132674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1660143069}
review:
"Strangeland" est un jeu point and click se déroulant dans une sorte de fête foraine abracadabrante, horrifique et maléfique. Le joueur incarne un individu particulièrement déjanté et perdu dans ce monde à la recherche d'une femme qui se suicide chaque jour.
Doté récemment d'une version VOSTFR, il est possible que le monde présenté par les auteurs ne plaise pas à tous les joueurs, quant aux énigmes elles sont bien dosées sans pour autant nous faire "péter" le cerveau. Trois fins possible : c'est vrai que j'en ai un peu marre de ce système, pour moi, un jeu a une fin et une seule... En conclusion, un jeu intéressant pour passer quelques heures (il est plutôt court mais vu le prix) dans les fanas de pointer et cliquer.
developer_response: Merci beaucoup!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148026607', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1658871742}
